results.title: The Big island
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The aim of this film is to show an international audience within a limited time span some attractive aspects of Australian life. Representing Australia as a brisk and exciting place and creating a mood of a young country on the move. Cinematography by Keith Gow, and Don McAlpine. Music by George Dreyfus. (Awards: AFI Travel Award 1970)

results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Roland Beckett and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An examination of the reactions of a career army man who is considering resigning to take advantage of an attractive offer to join a commercial organisation. Stars Bill Hunter as Major Archer.

results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Scouting in Australia
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Joe Scully, Australian Boy Scouts Association and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Illustrates the impact upon a boy of his joining the Scouts, the involvement of his father in the Movement, the Scouts’ work in the community and the international status of the Scouting Movement. Includes scenes of a Scout Rally, an investiture, a Group Committee and the ‘Jamboree of the New Endeavour’ at Leppington, N.S.W

results.title: Hassles
results.creator_credit: Jason Ollivier, Ross Simmons, Robin Hughes and Film Australia
results.brief_description: One of three films as part of the National Drug Education Program which takes an in-depth view of drug addiction in the day-to-day lives of ordinary people. The central character is a teenage boy who found the courage to give up heavy marijuana smoking. His motive was simply the challenge itself, but the price of his success is rejection by his lifelong friends and associates who accuse him of simply substituting one source of stimulation for another. Photography by Dean Semler. (See also ‘Thirst’ [012683] and ‘All in the same boat’ [012758].)

results.title: Drinking driving surviving
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Alcohol plays an important part in our society as a relaxant and a status symbol, but when mixed with driving the results can be disastrous. This film explores the pressures to drink, the myths to which many Australians subscribe about drinking and driving, and the stark fact that alcohol, even in small amounts, seriously impairs driving

results.title: Painting people
results.creator_credit: Tim Burstall, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Six Australian artists - William Dobell, Russell Drysdale, Clifton Pugh, William Dargie, Jan Molvig and Andrew Sibley - discuss the problems of portraiture, including paintings of Tom Roberts and Arthur Streeton.

results.title: Five bells: sights and sounds of Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Dean Semler, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Sydney Harbour, the most beautiful in the world, is celebrated in this lyrical documentary. Pre-dawn a memory of the Harbour’s convict past appears like a dream, but as the sun rises and the trawlers trek back with their cargo of prawns the Harbour comes to life in 1978. Australia’s multi-cultural society is epitomised in this film.

results.title: Leisure
results.creator_credit: Bruce Petty, Suzanne Baker and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A fast-paced, humorous film, animated by Bruce Petty. The film emphasises the use of leisure time as an important aspect of life in our society. Planning for recreation and leisure time should be undertaken both on a personal and a broad public level. (Awards: Winner of the 1976 American Academy Award for Best Animated Short Film)

results.title: Travellin' round
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Richard Mason, Film Australia and Tourism Australia
results.brief_description: A girl and a boy in a Landrover, a motorcyclist and a continent. These are the most essential ingredients of a travel film with a difference, showing the beauties and splendours of Australia. Featuring Tom Burstall, Adam Plate, Ingrid Tantu, Lloyd Sutton, Susan Hannaford. Music and lyrics by Michael Carlos and Judy Henderson.
